meanings.definition: A gentle splash or sound of water.
meanings.sent1: The plash of the small stream was soothing to listen to.
meanings.sent2: I heard the plash of raindrops on the roof.
meanings.sent3: The ducks enjoyed the plash of the fountain in the park.
meanings.sent4: The plash of the waves against the shore was like nature's lullaby.
meanings.sent5: The plash of the waterfall created a peaceful atmosphere in the forest.

meanings.definition: To splash or sprinkle with water.
meanings.sent1: She likes to plash water on her face to cool down.
meanings.sent2: The kids plash each other with water balloons in the summer.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally plashed water on his friend while washing the car.
meanings.sent4: The storm plashed rain against the windows all night long.
meanings.sent5: The elephant playfully plashed water at the visitors with its trunk.

meanings.definition: A woven fence made of branches or stakes.
meanings.sent1: The farmer built a sturdy plash around the garden to keep out animals.
meanings.sent2: The old plash around the field was starting to show signs of wear.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous goat managed to jump over the plash and into the vegetable patch.
meanings.sent4: The plash of branches created a natural barrier between the two properties.
meanings.sent5: The intricate plash added a rustic charm to the countryside landscape.
